page.title: 15Settlements-Bramshott
page.content: were reglazed in 1945, by a man called Martin Travers. The ancient roof was restored in memory of Gottlieb Freiedrick Plutte who died on the 24th of June 1937. The chancel was built in 1220 and the north transept in 1400. The church has 6 bells which were made in 1784 by Thomas Jannway from Chelsea. Under one of the arches of the church is displayed two memorial shields of the Churches' College and No. 811 Squadron,{Fleet Air Arm.} Thomas William Coke, Earl of Leicester, was buried in the church yard whilst in the church was buried Grissell, wife of Sir John Hooke in 1687. The Manor House in{Bramshott}is directly adjacent to the church and the area round the village is quite historical.
